rev.comment: revert: [[WP:NPOV|non-NPOV]], [[WP:CITE|uncited]], [[WP:NOR|original research]], take your pick... find some sources and the additions will be welcome
rev.diff:
Line 102: Line 102:
==Fan Behavior==
==Fan Behavior==
{{Unreferencedsect}}
{{Unreferencedsect}}
â
Eagles fans' devotion to the Eagles is reflected by team ticket sales: games are invariably sold-out, and there is a 60,000-member waiting list for season tickets. Most season tickets are passed down from generation to generation.
+
Eagles fans' devotion to the Eagles is reflected by team ticket sales: games are invariably sold-out, and there is a 60,000-member waiting list for season tickets.
â
Poor judgment and alcohol have occasionally led some Eagles fans to transgress the boundaries of civilized behavior. Such behavior is familiar to many who have attended professional sporting events virtually anywhere in the world, but Eagles fans have had the misfortune to misbehave in numerous high profile moments, many on national television. As such, Eagles fans have a reputation in many quarters as being unduly rowdy, or even dangerous. This reputaion is usually greatly fabricated and passed on like a campfire horror story. Furthermore, Philadelphia Eagles fans are the most passionate in the world and very knowledgeable on the game of football.
+
Poor judgment and alcohol have occasionally led some Eagles fans to transgress the boundaries of civilized behavior. Such behavior is familiar to many who have attended professional sporting events virtually anywhere in the world, but Eagles fans have had the misfortune to misbehave in numerous high profile moments, many on national television. As such, Eagles fans have a reputation in many quarters as being unduly rowdy, or even dangerous.
â   â
Philadelphia is a blue collar city and have very hard working fans who expect more from their team. The so called "Boo Birds" are there way of showing this displeasure and always in hopes and asperations of greatness. This is an underdog team with less superbowl wins than all its NFC East counterparts which in retrospect solidifies their identity.
  â   â
In 1991 they Philadelphia Eagles has the best Defense in the NFL (Known as the Gang Green Defense), many say the best ever.
  â
http://espn.go.com/page2/s/list/readers/bestNFLdefense.html
  â
With players like Hall of Famer Reggie White, Jerome Brown, Seth Joyner, Clyde Simmons, Wes Hopkins, Andre Watters, William Thomas, Eric Allen and more, they absolutley terrorized offenses and no one looked forward to see the Eagles on the calender that year. Due to a lackk of offense and poor ownership, they had a 10-6son that year which really undervalues that 91 defense, number 1 against the run and the pass.
 
The most (in)famous example of fan impropriety at Eagles games is the so-called "Santa Claus Incident," on [[December 15]], [[1968]], at [[Franklin Field]] in a 24-17 loss to the [[Minnesota Vikings]], in which angry fans, furious at the conclusion of yet another wasted season under head coach [[Joe Kuharich]] (including losing their first 11 games, then winning the next two, preventing the team from getting the first pick in the next year's draft, [[O.J. Simpson]]), booed and threw [[snowball]]s at a man dressed as Santa Claus during the halftime show.<ref name=usatoday-snowball>{{cite news

Simpson]]), booed and threw [[snowball]]s at a man dressed as Santa Claus during the halftime show.<ref name=usatoday-snowball>{{cite news
